activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A Lingis

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Christopher A Lingis appeared by video, in custody in Kenosha.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Christopher A Lingis.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests COP date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher A Lingis
Current: 540 Wilcox, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2022)
Prior: 6109 245th St, Paddock Lake, WI 53168

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.B (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

AMENDED 08-17: MAY HAVE NON VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.B

8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A Lingis in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Christopher A Lingis. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense has filed a bond motion requesting a lower cash bond. Also moves to lift the no contact order with the listed victim, modifying it to a no contact order.
State makes statement on the record.
BTC: Bond motion granted to $750 cash, bond condition modified to No violent contact with J.B, no alcohol with RCAP testing.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
